name: ICPC World Finals
description: ACM-ICPC World Finals programming competition evaluating team problem-solving, algorithm implementation, and debugging under time pressure.
source: ICPC Foundation (ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest)

metrics.name: problems_solved
metrics.definition: Number of problems solved correctly during the contest (typically 12-14 problems in 5 hours)

metrics.name: ranking
metrics.definition: Final ranking among competing teams based on problems solved and penalty time

test_method: Simulate ICPC World Finals: 12-14 problems, 5-hour time limit, team collaboration allowed. Rank by number solved (primary) and total time with penalties (secondary).
notes: ICPC World Finals represents elite university-level competitive programming. Problems span algorithms, mathematics, and implementation. Document whether model operated as single agent or simulated team collaboration. Penalty time includes wrong submissions.
